00022   // parses a logical condition, determines whether it is in the form (x <= y + c) and
00023   // if it is, sets x, y, c to be the unique ids of the relevant variables
00024   // If the condition is in a similar form (ex: x<y, x>c), x, y and c are normalized to the form x<=y+c
00025   // negX=true if x is supposed to be negated and false otherwise
00026   // negY=true if y is supposed to be negated and false otherwise
00027   bool computeTermsOfIfCondition_LTEQ(SgExpression *expr, varID &x, bool& negX, varID &y, bool& negY, long &c);
00028

00030   // if it is, sets x, y, c to be the unique ids of the relevant variables

00035   // returns true if SgNode contains an array access to any variable in arrays
00036   // wrIndex - map of i+c pairs that containsfor each variable in arrays all the indexes 
00037   //    used to access the array variable for a Write operation
00038   // rdIndex - map of i+c pairs that containsfor each variable in arrays all the indexes 
00039   //    used to access the array variable for a Read operation
00040   // rdFromExp - map of flags indicating for each variable in arrays whether ast_node 
00041   //    contains an array Read expression of this array with its index in the wrong format: 
00042   //    something other than i or i+c
00043   // wrFromExp - map of flags indicating for each variable in arrays whether ast_node 
00044   //    contains an array Write expression with its index in the wrong format: something 
00045   //    other than i or i+c
00046   bool
00047     findArrayAccesses(SgNode* ast_node, 
00048         m_varID2varID2quad &wrIndex, m_varID2varID2quad &rdIndex,
00049         m_varID2bool &rdFromExp, m_varID2bool &wrFromExp, 
00050         varIDSet arrays, m_varID2str vars2Name);
00051 
00052   // examines the given expression. 
00053   // If it is an array access, fills wrIndex with the ids of variables on the left-hand-side 
00054   //    of the assignment, fills rdIndex with the ids of variables on the right-hand-side 
00055   //    of the assignment and returns true.
00056   // Otherwise, returns false.
00057   // wrIndexSimp, rdIndexSimp - maps of array variables to variable/constant pairs. Each pair 
00058   //    contains i,c that represent the fact that the given array variable was accessed (for 
00059   //    writing or reading, respectively using the index expression [i+c], where i is a variable 
00060   //    and c is a constant
00061   // wrIndexCpx, rdIndexCpx -  lists of array variables that were accessed (for writing or 
00062   //    reading, respectively) using a complex index expression
00063   bool parseArrayAccess(SgNode* ast_node,
00064       m_varID2varID2quad& wrIndexSimp, varIDlist& wrIndexCpx, 
00065       m_varID2varID2quad& rdIndexSimp, varIDlist& rdIndexCpx,
00066       m_varID2str vars2Name);

00088   //    and sets i, j, k and c appropriately to represent an expression of the form
00089   //    i = j op k op c 
00090   //    where op may be either + (add), * (mult) or / (divide)

00094   // Returns true if the expression is of the permitted type
00095   //    and sets op, i, j and c appropriately to represent an expression of the form
00096   //    i op j op c 
00097   //    where op may be either + (add), * (mult) or / (divide)
00098   //    op may be = none if the rhs has only one term
00099   // This function parses non-assignment expressions such as i op j or c but not i = j op c, i op= j or i++
